citations.desc: Access and inspection of records and property; submission of itineraries.
citations.narrative:
The facility representative could not provide the following documents: the Program of Veterinary Care, Exercise plan for
dogs, acquisition and disposition records, itinerary, and contingency plan and training records of the contingency plan.
These documents are required to be made available to the APHIS official at the time of inspection. Each dealer, exhibitor,
intermediate handler, or carrier, shall, during business hours, allow APHIS officials: to examine records required to be
kept by the Act and the regulations in this part.
To be corrected by: August 2, 2023

citations.desc: Access and inspection of records and property; submission of itineraries.
citations.narrative:
At the time of inspection the facility representative was at an unknown off-site location with adult dogs performing dog
shows. No traveling (TRA) site has been added to their license and no itinerary was submitted. TRA sites are required
when traveling overnight and an itinerary submitted no fewer than 2 days in advance of any travel with complete and
accurate information concerning the whereabouts of any animal intended for exhibition at any location other than the
person's approved site.
To be corrected by: August 4, 2023

The paddock in the back end of the property containing 9 goats and 9 sheep had water receptacles with green, fuzzy,
clumps consistent with algae. The level of water was low on one receptacle and the other blue container had no water.
Clean receptacles are necessary for access to potable water. All water receptacles shall be kept clean and sanitary.
To be corrected by: August 2, 2023.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with Facility Representative.
Additional Inspectors:
Colette Kirk El-Amin, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER n

narrative:
2.126(a)(2) 
   
Access and inspection of records and property; submission of itineraries. 
The facility representative could not provide the following documents: the Program of Veterinary Care, Exercise plan for 
dogs, acquisition and disposition records, itinerary, and contingency plan and training records of the contingency plan. 
These documents are required to be made available to the APHIS official at the time of inspection. Each dealer, exhibitor, 
intermediate handler, or carrier, shall, during business hours, allow APHIS officials: to examine records required to be 
kept by the Act and the regulations in this part. 
 
To be corrected by: August 2, 2023 
2.126(c) 
   
Access and inspection of records and property; submission of itineraries. 
At the time of inspection the facility representative was at an unknown off-site location with adult dogs performing dog 
shows. No traveling (TRA) site has been added to their license and no itinerary was submitted. TRA sites are required 
when traveling overnight and an itinerary submitted no fewer than 2 days in advance of any travel with complete and 
accurate information concerning the whereabouts of any animal intended for exhibition at any location other than the 
person's approved site. 
 
To be corrected by: August 4, 2023 
3.130 
   
Watering. 
The paddock in the back end of the property containing 9 goats and 9 sheep had water receptacles with green, fuzzy, 
clumps consistent with algae. The level of water was low on one receptacle and the other blue container had no water. 
Clean receptacles are necessary for access to potable water. All water receptacles shall be kept clean and sanitary. 
 
To be corrected by: August 2, 2023.

This inspection and exit interview were conducted with Facility Representative. 
 
Additional Inspectors: 
Colette Kirk El-Amin, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER n
